meanings.definition: Make someone aware of or familiar with something.
meanings.sent1: I will acquaint my friend with the new game.
meanings.sent2: She decided to acquaint herself with the city before moving there.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to acquaint the dog with its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's goal is to acquaint the students with complex math concepts.
meanings.sent5: He used pictures to acquaint the children with different animals.

meanings.definition: Have knowledge or experience of something.
meanings.sent1: After reading the book, I became acquainted with the author's writing style.
meanings.sent2: She acquainted herself with the local customs during her travels.
meanings.sent3: The detective was well acquainted with the suspect's criminal history.
meanings.sent4: His years of practice acquainted him with the nuances of the art form.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's research acquainted her with the latest technological advancements.
